quoteFirst: "Men, you are here on a very solemn duty. You have been selected as a firing squad for the execution of a soldier, who, having been found guilty of a grievous crime against King and Country, has been regularly and duly tried and sentenced to be shot at
quoteLast: this date. This sentence has been approved by the reviewing authority and ordered carried out.
title:
"Over the Top," by an American Soldier Who Went
Together with Tommy's Dictionary of the Trenches
author: Empey, Arthur Guy, 1883-1963

quoteFirst: Will present its ordinary four changes at the following times: last quarter on the 7th, at 10:28 p. m.; new moon, 16th,
quoteLast: ; first quarter, 23d, 8:18 p. m.; full, 30th, 11:11 a. m. It will be in apogee, or farthest from the earth, on the 13th, at 3:42 a. m.
title: The Chautauquan, Vol. 05, January 1885, No. 4
author: Chautauqua Literary and Scientific Circle; Chautauqua Institution; Flood, Theodore L., 1842- [Editor]

quoteFirst: After we had gone about half way round, 'Now,' said Mr. Gurney, 'I will show you her speed.' He did, and we completed seven turns round the outside of the road by
quoteLast: . If, therefore, as I was there assured, two and a half turns measured one mile, we went 2.8 miles in ten minutes; that is, at the rate of 16.
title: The Mirror of Literature, Amusement, and Instruction. Volume 14, No. 391, September 26, 1829
author: Various
